pageTitle: iTunes - Music - Live Power Trio (Live) by Louis Bertignac
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {52011=Ai eu la chance de le voir aux Francofolies de Spa en juillet 2006 pour ce concert là. Fabuleuse ambiance, hyper sympa avec le public. Tous les 3 géants dont le batteur époustouflant, avec des reprises extraordinaires de morceaux légendaires (Led Zep, Stones, Who). Et ses morceaux à lui sont tout aussi bien fichus. C'est le meilleur album de rock live depuis bien longtemps. Aldo, 50464=Recorded on his 2005-2006 European tour, Live Power Trio is the third live album from French-Algerian guitarist and singer/songwriter Louis Bertignac, following 1993's Le Mediator and 1998's Bertignac Live. The two-CD, 27-track collection includes material from his time in Telephone ("Hygiaphone," "Un Autre Monde"), his two albums recorded with Les Visiteurs ("Reves," "Le Matin Au Reveil"), and his solo career, with tracks from his three studio albums, Elle et Louis, Bertignac '96, and Longtemps. Alongside several of his hit singles, there are performances of his Carla Bruni collaborations ("Sous La Pluie," "Les Froleuses"), and cover versions of Elvis Presley's "Blue Suede Shoes," the Who's "Won't Get Fooled Again" and the Rolling Stones' "Jumpin' Jack Flash." ~ Jon O'Brien, Rovi, 155325=Copyright © 2014 Apple Inc. Tous droits réservés.}

textAfterTable: 27 Songs Album Review Recorded on his 2005-2006 European tour, Live Power Trio is the third live album from French-Algerian guitarist and singer/songwriter Louis Bertignac, following 1993's Le Mediator and 1998's Bertignac Live. The two-CD, 27-track collection includes material from his time in Telephone ("Hygiaphone," "Un Autre Monde"), his two albums recorded with Les Visiteurs ("Reves," "Le Matin Au Reveil"), and his solo career, with tracks from his three studio albums, Elle et Louis, Bertignac '96, and Longtemps. Alongside several of his hit singles, there are performances of his Carla Bruni collaborations ("Sous La Pluie," "Les Froleuses"), and cover versions of Elvis Presley's "Blue Suede Shoes," the Who's "Won't Get Fooled Again" and the Rolling Stones' "Jumpin' Jack Flash." ~ Jon O'Brien, Rovi Customer Reviews Une merveille - incontournable           by Aldo57 Ai eu la chance de le voir aux Francofolies de Spa en juillet 2006 pour ce concert là. Fabuleuse ambiance, hyper sympa avec le public. Tous les 3 géants dont le batteur époustouflant, avec des reprises extraordinaires de morceaux légendaires (Led Zep, Stones, Who).
